item.title: Directive on Federal Contracting Cost-Effectiveness
item.description: This executive order aims to improve the cost-effectiveness of federal contracting processes by eliminating unnecessary and imprudent expenditures of taxpayer funds. It emphasizes adherence to statutory preferences and seeks to establish more fiscal responsibility within federal procurement practices. The order outlines strategies to ensure that federal contracting decisions prioritize commercial solutions that deliver value for taxpayers and mitigate wastefulness in spending.
